result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott James Blau

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 11:02 AM: Defendant Scott James Blau in court. Attorney Brian Lee Mares in court for Scott James Blau. Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court regarding discovery motions filed. Statement by DA Leusink regarding phone evidence. Clarification by Atty Mares. The Court advises any audio recordings in any format are subject to discovery requests. DA Leusink will work with the detective to make these available. Statement by Atty Mares regarding evidence pertaining to exchange of photos. Statement by Atty Mares regarding the subpoena language used to gather digital evidence. Statement by DA Leusink. DA Leusink suggests documents regarding the digital evidence be forwarded to the Court for in camera review first. Clarification by the parties regarding dates in question. The Court grants production of the evidence. Statement by the Court regarding the elements of Count 1. The images are to be exclusively provided to Atty Mares by the DA. STC scheduled - NOH given.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Case called @ 10:50 AM Defendant Scott James Blau in court.  Attorney Brian Lee Mares in court for Scott James Blau.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Detective Brandon Rasmussen sworn in for testimony. Direct exam by ADA Kottke. Witness identifies the defendant. The Court reserves the identification of the defendant by the witness subject to foundation. Exhibit 1 marked. Witness testifies to exhibit 1. ADA Kottke offers exhibit 1. Atty Mares objects. The Court receives exhibit 1. Cross exam by Atty Mares. Redirect by ADA Kottke. The Court finds probable case. Defendant BOT. Arraignment scheduled -

records.addlTxt:
10:45 AM Defendant Scott James Blau appeared in court, Attorney Brian Lee Mares appeared by phone. Attorney Wesley J Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant re: personal appearance. Defendant waives personal appearance and court accepts waiver. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   PH Scheduled - NOH Given.  Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 000433,
Payable Number: 107124,
Receipt Number: 22R 000815,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant is prohibited from having contact with any minors under the age of 18 unless in the immediate presence of a parent or guardian. Defendant is prohibited from being on the presence of any school or any facility principally devoted to the service of children. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of a cell phone or electronic device capable of accessing the internet or sending/receiving images.

Case called @ 1:22 PM Defendant Scott James Blau appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Emma K Blankschein appeared by video for Scott James Blau, Attorney Wesley J Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $7500 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
